name: Clin T Urethra
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  In case of multifocal noninvasive Ta and Tis tumors, assign pTis. 

**Note 2:**  If assigned pTis, then Behavior code ICD-O-3 must be /2.

**Note 3:**  The presence of muscle around the urethra varies between males and females and, in males, varies among the segments of the urethra. The outer muscular coat (muscularis) is absent in most of the male urethra except for the membranous portion. In females, the muscle coat is continuous from the bladder wall. In addition, in both males and females, there is sphincteric muscle, which may be smooth or skeletal muscle. 
* Invasion of periurethral muscle is assigned T1, unless it is specified as invasion of sphincter muscle, which is assigned T2
* Invasion of muscle at the neck of the bladder is assigned T3
* If the only information is "invasion of muscle", NOS, or "invasion of periurethral muscle", NOS, assign T1
rows:

    Physician unable to assess T 
    Extension cannot be determined

Non-invasive papillary, polypoid, or verrucous carcinoma

Histologically confirmed:
Intraepithelial, noninvasive (flat, sessile), NOS
Carcinoma in situ, involvement of prostatic ducts

Histologically confirmed:
Intraepithelial, noninvasive: involvement of prostatic ducts
Carcinoma in situ, involvement of prostatic urethra

Histologically confirmed: 
Intraepithelial, noninvasive: involvement of prostatic urethra

Subepithelial connective tissue (lamina propria, submucosa) invaded

Localized, NOS

Stated as T1

Tumor invades any of the following: 
    Corpus spongiosum
    Periurethral muscle
    Prostate

Muscularis invaded

Sphincter muscle; periurethral muscle specified as sphincter

Stated as T2

Tumor invades any of the following: 
    Beyond prostatic capsule 
    Bladder neck (extraprostatic extension)
    Corpus cavernosum

Vagina, anterior or NOS

Stated as T3
Tumor invades other adjacent organs (invasion of the bladder)

Other adjacent organs, including
    Bladder (excluding bladder neck)
    Seminal vesicle(s)

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4

Primary site/histology not TNM defined
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Clinical classification criteria not met 
Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    No information about diagnostic workup
    Results not documented in record
Clinical evaluation of primary tumor not done or unknown if done
Tumor first detected on surgical resection (no clinical workup)
Evidence of metastatic disease [(cM1) or (pM1)], no other workup
Only Clinical Stage Group documented (no T, N, or M information available)
